bio.p: Francis Kombe is a Public Health, Community Engagement, Communication, Capacity Building and Bioethics practitioner. He has a wealth of experience working in international health research institutions, where he has held various leadership positions. He is a founding and steering committee member of the African Research Integrity Network (ARIN) and chairs the Ethics, Community Engagement and Patients Advocacy and Support (ECEPAS) Working Group under The Global Emerging Pathogens Treatment Consortium (GET). He is a member of the Pwani University Research Ethics Committee and an expert committee member of the Data Governance Committee at the African Academy of Sciences. He has published widely in the field of community engagement, health research fieldworkers, research integrity, fair study benefits and informed consent among others
